business.headline: Sensex, Nifty start on a weak note; HUL falls 3% in early tradeThe S&P BSE Sensex declined 81.66 points to 76,323.33, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 17.55 points to 23,137.80 as of 9:32 AM.

Trump's tariff threat: India eyes lower tariffs, higher imports, says reportThe government is considering options such as reducing tariffs, trade deals, and importing more goods from the US to negate the tariff threat if it becomes a reality.

India least vulnerable but Trump unpredictable person: Martin Wolf Martin Wolf, speaking on the sidelines of the World Economic Forum in Davos, said that India is least vulnerable to Donald Trump's tariff threat.

Should you convert your credit card bills into EMIs? Check hereCredit card EMI conversion: Converting credit card bills into EMIs offers immediate relief by breaking big payments into smaller and manageable amounts.
What is UPI Circle? 5 things you need to know UPI Circle is a solution where a primary user authorises a secondary user to make payments from their account.

IT rally saves the day on Dalal Steet; Wipro, Infosys among top gainersThe biggest gainers during the session were IT stocks, with the Nifty IT index rising 2.14%, the highest among all other sectoral indices.

Budget 2025: Why financial services sector needs a 'digital lending' boostBudget 2025 would play a key role in driving the country's economic growth through enhanced credit access to the rural and underserved sectors of the economy.

HDFC Bank Q3 results: Net profit rises 2.2% to Rs 16,736 croreThe private lender reported a 7.6% increase in interest earned, which came to Rs 76,007 crore compared to Rs 70,583 in the same quarter of the previous financial year.

Budget 2025: How government can provide relief to taxpayersBudget 2025 and income tax: The country's vast middle-class population is also calling for the inclusion of tax-saving provisions and deductions under the new income tax regime.

Will Donald Trump's tariff suspense hurt Indian stocks? All you need to knowDonald Trump has also threatened BRICS nations with up to 100% tariffs against taking a decision that could lead to de-dollarisation of the global economy.

Budget 2025: 3 things government should focus on to tackle climate changeBudget 2025 expectations: Experts said climate action is the need of the hour and announcements related to clean energy will be crucial. There could be a push to boost green jobs as well.

Explained: Why ICICI Prudential shares tumbled 10% after Q3 resultsICICI Prudential share price: The company's share price decline came a day after Q3FY25 results, where it reported a 43% rise in net profit to Rs 326 crore.

Zomato shares down over 23% in a month. Should you buy or avoid?Zomato share price: The food delivery giant's stock price has fallen over 14% in the previous two sessions and over 23% in the past month.

Denta Water IPO opens for bidding: Should you subscribe? Check latest GMPDenta Water and Infra Solutions IPO: The price band for the IPO of Denta Water has been set at Rs 279-294 per share with retail investors required to invest a minimum of Rs 14,700. The minimum lot size for an application is 50.

Sensex, Nifty open higher driven by a rally in IT sector stocks; Wipro gains 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 246.41 points to 76,084.77, while the NSE Nifty50 added 62.15 points to 23,086.80 as of 9:26 AM.

HDFC Bank to announce Q3 results today: Here's what to expectHDFC Bank Q3 FY25 Results Expectations: Investors will be keeping a keen eye on the results as the stock of HDFC Bank has fallen 8.62% in the last month.

Budget 2025: Raghuram Rajan says tax cuts won't solve India's fiscal problemsFormer RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan said that he is not worried about the reduction in tax rates but instead about the need for more effective government spending, particularly in human capital development.

Stocks to watch today: HCLTech, HDFC Bank, HUL, Tata Communication, ZomatoHDFC Bank, Hindustan Unilever (HUL), and Tata Communication will be announcing their Q3 FY25 results today, hence their stocks will likely see some action.

Ex-RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan speaks on Trump's tariffs, job creation and othersFormer RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan highlighted his views on issues like US President Donald Trump's plans to impose tariffs on some countries, including India, and how the economy and job creation is progressing under the Narendra Modi-led central government.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Kapil Sharma, Rajpal Yadav, 2 others get threat mail: Not a publicity stunt Initial investigations revealed that the IP address of the threat email received by the four celebrities was traced to Pakistan, police said.

S Jaishankar's one-liner on front row seat at Trump's swearing-inExternal Affairs Minister S Jaishankar represented India at Trump's swearing-in ceremony at the invitation of the US government and carried a letter from Prime Minister Narendra Modi to the new President.

Jalgaon train accident toll spikes to 13, Rs 1.5 lakh aid announced for victimsTrain Accident In Maharashtra's Jalgaon: Passengers of the Pushpak Express, alarmed by a suspected fire, jumped off the train, and were hit by the Karnataka Express, coming from the opposite direction on an adjacent track.

Crowds have gathered in numbers to catch the long awaited return of the India skipper to Ranji Trophy.

Critical issue, needs attention: S Jaishankar to US counterpart on visa delaysDuring his first bilateral meeting with the new US Secretary of State Marco Rubio, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar raised concerns about the prolonged delays faced by Indian citizens in obtaining US visas.

One of the coolest moments of JD Vance's life: When Trump showed him Oval OfficeJD Vance visited the Oval Office for the first time ever after he took oath as the Vice President. His reaction to the President's office was captured in a video.

Chris Martin interacts with Sachin Tendulkar at event, fans call it 'fire meet'Coldplay's Chris Martin shared a light-hearted moment with former cricketer Sachin Tendulkar at an event in Mumbai last night. A video of their interaction is going viral on social media, with fans enthusiastically reacting to it.

Revanth Reddy aims to secure projects worth Rs 1 lakh crore at Davos summitTelangana Chief Minister Revanth Reddy discussed the state's investment progress. He aims for projects worth Rs 1 lakh crore this year, highlighting Hyderabad's appeal to global investors and its growing tech sectors.

Los Angeles faces another massive wildfire, evacuation order for over 50,000   A new wildfire, the Hughes fire, has prompted evacuation orders for over 50,000 people in Los Angeles. Spanning 9,000 acres with zero containment, it follows recent wildfires near Lake Castaic, spreading widespread destruction.

Pushpa 2 OTT release: Will Allu Arjun film stream on Netflix on January 30?Pushpa 2 OTT release date: Allu Arjun and director Sukumar's Pushpa 2: The Rule is still running successfully in theatres. Now, reports are rife that the film might be available on Netflix by the end of January.

Third part of knife used to attack Saif Ali Khan found near Bandra lakeThe first part of the 2.5-inch-long knife, which was lodged in Saif Ali Khan's body after the attack, was removed during emergency surgery and another part of the weapon was recovered later.

Always open to legitimate return of undocumented Indians, says S JaishankarIndia remains open to the lawful return of undocumented Indians abroad, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said. Speaking about deportations from the US, he emphasised verifying individuals' citizenship while opposing illegal migration.

Pawan Kalyan's Jana Sena Party officially a 'recognised regional party' The Election Commission of India included the Jana Sena Party in the list of recognised parties in Andhra Pradesh. The party has been allotted "glass tumbler" as its permanent election symbol.

Samsung Galaxy S25 series launched: Price, full specs, featuresThe Samsung Galaxy S25 series has finally launched in India. The latest Samsung Galaxy S25 series comes with a starting price of $799 (around Rs 69,000) in the US. The India prices of the new flagship phones are also out, starting at Rs 80,999.

Elon Musk snipes at OpenAI's Sam Altman over Trump-backed Stargate, he claps backThe clash over Stargate is the latest chapter in a years-long dispute between Elon Musk and Sam Altman, who co-founded OpenAI together.

Ram Gopal Varma convicted in cheque bounce case, non-bailable warrant issuedRam Gopal Varma was absent when the verdict in a cheque bounce case against him was announced, leading the court to issue a non-bailable warrant against him.

MF Hussain painting row: Delhi court reserves order on plea against art galleryDelhi police informed the court on Tuesday that the said paintings portraying Hindu deities in a controversial manner by artist MF Husain have been seized.

Trump taps head of his personal security detail to lead US Secret ServiceDonald Trump has selected Sean Curran, his personal security chief, as director of the US Secret Service. Trump praised Curran's leadership and trustworthiness, despite bipartisan recommendations favouring an external candidate for the role.

Khushbu hosts birthday bash for Sundar C: Mani Ratnam, Vadivelu and celebs attendActor-politician Khushbu hosted a star-studded birthday bash for her director-husband Sundar C. Mani Ratnam, Vadivelu, Radikaa Sarathkumar, Vishal and several others from the industry attended the party.

Rashmika says 'happy enough to retire' after playing Maharani Yesubai in ChhaavaRashmika Mandanna expressed her overwhelming joy and honour at being cast as Maratha queen Yesubai Bhonsale in the film Chhaava. At the trailer launch, the actor stated she feels content enough to retire after this role.

Abhishek Bachchan: Before I go to God, I go to my parentsAbhishek Bachchan highlights the importance of family and legacy in a recent interview, expressing his deep connection to his family and the creative heritage he cherishes. He also equates his parents to God.

Abhishek lit up the Eden Gardens in the 1st T20I match vs England and scored a match-winning innings laced with 8 sixes and 5 boundaries.

Varun Chakravarthy rates his bowling heroics in Kolkata T20I 7 out of 10India vs England, 1st T20I: India spinner Varun Chakravarthy delivered a match-winning performance in the first T20I against England, taking three wickets. However, Varun modestly admitted that there's still room for improvement, rating his Kolkata heroics as just a seven out of 10.

Hardik is key to India's 'different' approach post T20 World Cup: SuryakumarHardik Pandya is a key member of the Indian T20I side, said Suryakumar Yadav after winning the 1st T20I match vs England. India started their series with a dominant win, clinching the opener of the 5-match series by 7 wickets in Kolkata.

Hardik Pandya goes past Jasprit Bumrah in list of most T20I wickets for IndiaHardik Pandya went past Jasprit Bumrah in the list of most T20I wickets for India. Pandya registered the figures of 2/42 in the first T20I against England.

Jos Buttler kick starts McCullum era with brisk fifty in Kolkata T20I England captain Jos Buttler began the Brendon McCullum era with a solid and fighting fifty in the first T20I against India at the Eden Gardens in Kolkata.

Arshdeep breaks Chahal's record, becomes India's leading T20I wicket-takerIndia vs England, 1st T20I: Arshdeep Singh struck twice in the powerplay in Kolkata to peg England back. With the double strike, he went past Yuzvendra Chahal's tally for the most wickets by an Indian in the shortest format of the game.

Watch: Lewis Hamilton's first drive in Ferrari's Formula 1 carLewis Hamilton drove a bright red Ferrari Formula 1 car for the first time ahead of the upcoming season. Ferrari posted the video of Hamilton taking the car for a spin in the team's test track in Italy.

Mohammed Shami's return delayed, pacer left out of Kolkata T20IIndia vs England, 1st T20I: After adding him to the squad for the T20I series against England, the Indian team management decided not to pick Mohammed Shami in the playing XI for the series opener in Kolkata.

Afghanistan women cricketer urges men's team to be the 'voice of girls'Afghanistan cricketer Firooza Amiri said that the women's cricketers in Afghanistan could flourish if the men's team raise their voices. After the Taliban took charge in 2021, women in the country were disallowed from working or playing any sport.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
